results.title: Ship No. 76
results.brief_description: Shows all stages of the construction of the 18,600 ton oil tanker, B.P. Endeavour, at the Newcastle State Dockyard. The Endeavour was the largest ship built in Australia up to 1967.

results.title: Roots of happiness
results.creator_credit: Henwar Rodakiewicz, Puerto Rico. Dept. of Health and Sun Dial Films
results.brief_description: Docudram about two families in Puerto Rico, one a happy one in which the father and mother love each other and their children, the other one in which there are too many children, no understanding between the parents, and neglected and unhappy children, are contrasted to show the importance of well-adjusted, tolerant, loving parents in the development of happy productive children. Strong comparison made between children and trees, both of which should be planted far enough apart and in a number that can be properly cared for, thus raising questions of birth control.

results.title: The Queen Returns
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Stanley Hawes and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The visit of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth and His Royal Highness Prince Phillip to Australia. Much of the film is devoted to Canberra and its history as the Queen’s visit coincided with Canberra’s Jubilee Celebrations.

results.title: Personal Hygiene For Boys (second edition)
results.brief_description: Designed to increase the understanding of personal hygiene - this film shows the importance of proper rest, diet and exercise to good health and appearance. It also deals with the special problems teenage boys have regarding personal hygiene and the changes taking place in their maturing bodies.

results.title: The Other Face of the Island
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale, Norman Laird, Tasfilm Productions and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: Using special cinematograph effects such as split screens, this film sets up a storyline to promote the resources and industries of Tasmania. The main products and secondary industries are grouped broadly into wool and textiles, including carpets; paper; processed food; and metal products. The cast includes four Australian models - Wendy Gilmore, Nola Clark, Carol Stevens and Barbara Wilding - outfitted by Prue Acton.

results.title: On time
results.creator_credit: Victorian Railways, Eric Thompson and Department of the Interior
results.brief_description: More than 100,000 train passengers pass through the gates at Flinders Street Station, Melbourne each day. Control of passenger and freight trains in and out of the station on time is a masterpiece of precision planning.

results.title: On the ball (1st Version)
results.brief_description: A humorous commentary on the game of Australian football. Go there, see it all. The screams, the advice, friendly admonitions. An analysis of the various aspects of Australian Rules Football spectatorship.

results.title: Om and Prom from Cambodia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Friends”.
A day in the life of two Cambodian boys. Shows them at school, at play, at home and working in the rice fields. They ride on elephants to the ruins of Angkor where they see the age-old ritual of the beautiful palace dancers.

results.title: The Narwhals came
results.brief_description: Shows records of undersea life made by divers in Arctic waters. Includes photography of the Narwhal whale, sought by hunters for its prized ivory tusk.

results.title: A Moving Picture
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale and Tasfilm Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the operation of air, sea, road and rail services in Tasmania, the important part they play in the State’s economy and the use made of them by local industries.
